intro: Commelinantia anomala, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and striking plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes a variety of grass-like and flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its unique, delicate appearance, featuring strap-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It is often found growing epiphytically on trees in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
